H0.text: Judge Jeffreys presided over the trials of 1685 following which rebellion. Rye House Plot

H1.text: Judge Jeffreys presided over the trials of 1685 following which rebellion. Argyll's Rising

H2.text: Judge Jeffreys presided over the trials of 1685 following which rebellion. English Civil War

H3.text: Judge Jeffreys presided over the trials of 1685 following which rebellion. MONMOUTH

A4.text: The subsequent Bloody Assizes of Judge Jeffreys were a series of trials of Monmouth's supporters in which 320 people were condemned to death and around 800 sentenced to be transported to the West Indies, for ten years' hard labour.

A5.text: Monmouth was captured and beheaded for treason on 15 July 1685, while around 1,000 of his supporters were executed or transported in what became known as the Bloody Assizes.
